summary: An assume-statement enforces an invariant, when they are enabled.
details: If the condition evaluates to false, then an $AssertionFailedException$ will be thrown.
If the condition evaluates to true, then execution simply continues onward.
Unlike an Assert Statement, assume-statements can be disabled.
If assume-statements are disabled, then the runtime simply ignores all assume-statements.
The condition will be unboxed, if necessary.
static-checks: The type of condition must be assignable to type boolean.
The type of message must be assignable to type java.lang.String.
